data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Once your head face forward keep moving forward one step at a time and never turn backward. Repeat the process until you return back to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around is to return back to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you take 10 steps back in the same sequence, you are taking 6 steps + 4 steps + 4 steps = 18 steps back to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turning left means you’re already in the right lane. If you take a step, you’re in the right lane. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You cannot turn around and return to the starting point at the same time. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The directions are the same except the opposite direction they were taken (turn left). So, the answer is Yes.

If you take two steps, the distance between you and the starting point will be the same. So, the answer is No.

If we are facing forward we must always take 1 step left. The step left should always be taken in the opposite direction we are facing. When we always take 1 step left we must always take 4 steps forward. So, the answer is No.

Turn around is not a necessary step, but turns around will return you back to your original location. So, the answer is Yes.

When you always face forward, you return to the beginning. So, the answer is yes.

We always have our faces forward. If we return to a starting point, we always face the same direction as the original starting point. It takes three steps forward to go back wards. Take 1 step forward to walk forward. There is 6 steps left to go backwards. There are 6 steps left to go forward before returning to the starting point. Thus, the answer is yes.

You always face forward when you are walking. Step forward and step left means you are going to move forward 3 times. Step right and step left means you are going to move back 1 time. So, the answer is Yes.
